pricingengine.featurizers package¶

Submodules¶

pricingengine.featurizers.default_dynamic_featurizer module¶

pricingengine.featurizers.default_dynamic_featurizer.get_featurizer(schema, max_lag=4, min_lag=0, geometric_weight=0.8, exclude_dummies=None)¶

Retruns a list of VarBuilders used to create features for a dynamic_dml application. Unlike default_panel_featurizer this function DOES create features from lagged values of TREATMENT and OUTCOME variables

Parameters:
  • schema –
  • max_lag – max number of lags to use to construct features (default=4)
  • min_lag – min number of lags to use to construct features (default=0), this includes the current period)
  • geometric_weight – decay value corresponding to lagged data that is applied to create an aggregate of past lags
  • exclude_dummies – a list of categorical columns names that the user wishes to exclude from modeling
Returns:

list of VarBuilders

pricingengine.featurizers.default_panel_featurizer module¶

pricingengine.featurizers.default_panel_featurizer.get_featurizer(schema, panel_var_dummies=True, time_dummies=True, scale_features=False)¶

Return a list of VarBuilders used to create features for a dynamic_dml application. Unlike default_dynamic_featurizer this function DOES NOT create features from lagged values of TREATMENT and OUTCOME variables

Parameters:
  • schema –
  • panel_var_dummies – Bool (default True) for whether we should create dummies from panel vars
  • time_dummies – Bool (default True) for whether we should create dummies from time vars
  • scale_features – Bool (default False) for whether numeric columns should be scaled before being featurized
Returns:

list of VarBuilders
